title: Prep football: No. 1 Pierz prevails
text:
Prep football: No. 1 Pierz prevails Tom Elliott , telliott@stcloudtimes.com 10:07 p.m. CDT October 24, 2015 Buy Photo Pierz's Derick Hall breaks an Annandale tackler and looks for an open lane to run in the first half Saturday, Oct. 4 at Husky Stadium. (Photo: Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudt) Buy Photo 
The top-ranked and undefeated Pierz Pioneers got a tough game for the first time this year. 
Noah Boser welcomed it. Kolton Eischens was a bit ticked about it. 
Pierz beat Annandale 18-12 Saturday evening at St. Cloud State's Husky Stadium. 
It gave the Pioneers (10-0) their third straight Section 5-3A title. 
"Gosh, we haven't had one like that all year," said Boser, who scored two touchdowns at running back and also had a big game defensively. "I think this is helping us out a lot, actually. 
"This is going to help us be ready at state." Buy Photo Annandale's Brett Wadman bobbles the ball for a few yards before getting control for a completion. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudt Buy Photo Pierz's Noah Boser pushes away Annandale's Brett Wadman and continues on his run in the second half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudt Annandale's Brett Wadman intercepts a pass intended for Pierz's Michael Meyer in the first half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Pierz fans cheer the players during introductions before the start of their game against Annandale in the Section 5-3A title game Saturday, Oct. 4 at Husky Stadium. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudt Fullscreen Buy Photo Pierz's Noah Boser 24 ties unsuccessfully to pick off a pass to Annandale's Cory Schmidt in the second half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Annandale's Reed Rasset tries unsuccessfully to get his hands on a pass in the second half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Pierz fans cheer as their team scores their second touchdown in the first half against Annandale. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudt Fullscreen Buy Photo Pierz's Kolton Eischens (20) drops Annandale's Reed Rasset in the end zone for a safety in the second half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Pierz's Derick Hall breaks an Annandale tackler and looks for an open lane to run in the first half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Pierz's Jonny Kasper breaks into open field against Annandale for a gain in the first half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Annandale players come onto the field during introductions. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Pierz's Jonny Kasper finds a hole in the Annandale line to run in the first half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Buy Photo Annandale's Reed Rasset is brought down by Pierz's Brett Kapsner on a run in the first half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudt Pierz's mascot celebrates a big first down. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Pierz's Derick Hall breaks through the Annandale line on a run in the first half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Pierz's Jonny Kasper finds a hole in the Annandale line to run in the first half. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Annandale quarterback Brock Fobbe sets up to throw against Pierz. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Pierz's Derick Hall gains a few more yards before being brought down. Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudtimes.com Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide 
Third-seeded Annandale (7-4) kept this one close throughout. Pierz led 14-6 at halftime, but the Cardinals cut it to 14-12 when Dondrae Burns scored on a one-yard TD run with 3:31 to go in the third quarter. 
Annandale missed the two-point conversion twice. The first one had a pass interference penalty called. The second was broken up. 
Then, the Pioneers picked up a pair of fourth-quarter safeties. Eischens had the first one. He tackled Annandale running back Reed Rasset in the end zone with 5:58. It came right after the Cardinals recovered a fumble at their own 3-yard line. 
"This was a wake-up call definitely for this team," said Eischens, a senior defensive back. "I think a lot of the kids thought we'd roll them like the last time." 
Pierz opened the season with a 38-12 over Annandale. But this one was a lot different. 
"We knew coming in that Annandale was a lot better," Pierz head coach Leo Pohlkamp said. "The first game doesn't mean (anything)." 
Pierz picked up another safety when Annandale voluntarily took one on fourth down on its own 1-yard line. That made it 18-12 and that held up. 
"Hats off to Annandale," Boser said. "They played a great game and they really are improved." 
Pierz plays Albany in the state Class 3A quarterfinals at 5 p.m. Saturday at St. Cloud State. Buy Photo 
Pierz's Noah Boser 24 ties unsuccessfully to pick off a pass to Annandale's Cory Schmidt in the second half Saturday, Oct. 4 at Husky Stadium. (Photo: Jason Wachter, jwachter@stcloudt)

Individual statistics 
Rushing: A — Reed Rasset 15-32, Brock Fobbe 7-6, Cory Schmidt 1-5, Burns 1-1, Tomberlin 1-(-1). Total: 25-43. P — Jonny Kasper 24-125, Noah Boser 11-61, Derick Hall 9-41, Lane Girtz 12-28, Aaron Weber 2-(-6), team 2-(-13). Total: 60-236. 
Passing: A — Fobbe 7-16-1 151, Brett Wadman 0-1-0. P — Weber 4-10-1 75. 
Receiving: A — Wadman 3-99, Burns 3-52, Rasset 1-0. P — Michael Meyer 3-64, Kolton Eischens 1-11.
